alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 7:38PM CST until February 24 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Elk River above Fayetteville affecting Lincoln and Franklin TN Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elk River above Fayetteville. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.7 feet, Flood waters reach the City Pumping Station in Fayetteville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Wednesday was 21.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 8.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.7 feet on 12/02/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
